conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render successfully demonstrates a true 3D transformation with visible wall height and thickness, perceptible interior volumes, an angled view, and a cleanly removed roof.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have good height and thickness (5). Floors are clear (3). Interior volume is perceivable (4). Proper 3D wall corner geometry (3). Angled view is good (5). Interior visible from elevated perspective (3). Minimal perspective distortion (2). Roof/ceiling removed cleanly (5). Interior spaces fully visible (3). Clean geometry without broken sections (2).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms (3). Adjacency relations are correct (4). Relative room proportions are preserved (3). Major room identities match the 2D (2). Major wall positions align (5). Wall lengths are proportional (3). Internal partitions are correctly placed (2). Doors are present and on correct walls, but one toilet door is a bit misaligned (3/4). Windows are present and on correct walls (2). Openings are proportionally sized and oriented, though the 'balc' opening is a solid wall instead of open access (1/2).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present: bed, sofa, dining table (4). Kitchen elements are present (2). Bathroom fixtures are present (2). Furniture is placed in correct rooms (3). Furniture scale seems reasonable (2). Orientation is logical (2).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, openings are clearly distinguishable (4). Geometry is readable (4). Interior is clearly visible (3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3). Consistent material usage (2). No major rendering artifacts (2). Clean background/presentation (1/2, as the background is a simple color, but the lighting creates some harsh shadows).

detected_errors.description: The door to the toilet is slightly misaligned with its opening, creating a small gap or overlap.
The balcony opening is rendered as a solid wall, effectively closing off access to the balcony area which should be more open, impacting the flow and intended use of space.

summary: The conversion is an excellent, geometrically faithful 3D transformation of the 2D floor plan, accurately representing most architectural elements and maintaining good visual clarity, with only minor deviations in door alignment and balcony access.
